'Feverfew' ('Tanacetum parthenium') is a traditional medicinal herb which is
found in many old gardens, and is also occasionally grown for ornament. The
plant grows into a small bush up to around high with citrus-scented leaves, and
is covered by flowers reminiscent of daisies. It spreads rapidly, and they will
cover a wide area after a few years. It is also commonly seen in the literature
by its synonyms, Chrysanthemum parthenium and Pyrethrum parthenium. It is also
sometimes referred to as 'bachelor's buttons' or 'featherfew'.
